qas.question: Portuguese pavement is known by what other name?
What is the most common pattern for Portuguese pavement?
Which city has almost all of its sidewalks in Portuguese pavement?
What other cityscape is done with Portuguese pavement?

context: Portuguese pavement (in Portuguese, <a0_0>Calçada Portuguesa<a0_0/>) is a kind of <a1_0>two-tone stone mosaic paving<a1_0/> created in Portugal, and common throughout the Lusosphere. Most commonly taking the form of <a2_0>geometric<a2_0/> patterns from the simple to the complex, it also is used to create complex pictorial mosaics in styles ranging from iconography to classicism and even modern design. In Portuguese-speaking countries, many cities have a large amount of their sidewalks and even, though far more occasionally, <a4_0>streets<a4_0/> done in this mosaic form. <a3_0>Lisbon<a3_0/> in particular maintains almost all walkways in this style.
